**Tender Notice: Highway 5 Renovations in Wood Buffalo National Park**
===============

**Notice Type:** Invitation to Qualify (ISQ)

**Contracting Entity:** Parks Canada

**Project Location:** Wood Buffalo National Park, Northwest Territories

**Project Description:** Parks Canada requires renovations to Highway 5 located in Wood Buffalo National Park. Work includes:

* Supply of chip seal aggregate
* Surface mixing and compaction
* Roadway failure repairs
* Application of an asphaltic surface treatment

**Estimated Contract Value:** $5,001,001 or more

**Deliverables:** Contractor shall perform and complete the Work no later than September 15, 2024.

**Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price

**Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Notice URL:** Not available

**Attachments:**

* Invitation to Qualify (ITQ-VIT) document
* Bid solicitation document

**Submission Guidelines:**

* Bids must be submitted via email to soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca or fax to 1-855-983-1808
* Bids received in-person or by courier will not be accepted
* Maximum email file size: 15 megabytes
* Attachments must be included with the submission, not linked
* Submission guidelines are outlined in the ITQ-VIT document

**Partner with Indigenous Business:**

* Interested Indigenous businesses can add their company name to the list by contacting the Contracting Officer
* In Stage 2, bidders will be evaluated on their firm guarantee to use Indigenous sub-contractors and suppliers

**Contracting Officer:**

* Name: Jen Maheu
* Email: jennifer.maheu@pc.gc.ca
* Phone: (587) 432-8458

**Bidder Requirements:**

* Bidders must meet the qualification criteria outlined in the ITQ-VIT document
* Bidders must have a good understanding of the project requirements and specifications

**Evaluation Criteria:**

* Qualification evaluation: 50%
* Financial bid evaluation: 50%

**Awarding of Contract:**

* The contract will be awarded to the bidder with the lowest price
* The contract will be awarded on a best value basis, taking into account the evaluation criteria outlined above.
